level.text: An organization that regularly transports persons who meet one or more of the requirements in § 2701.1 may apply to the Director for special license tags or a special parking permit.
The application shall include proof, as required by the Director, as to the nature and activities of the organization.
A vehicle displaying special license tags issued pursuant to § 2707.1 shall meet all District of Columbia vehicle registration eligibility requirements.
Only one special parking permit may be issued for each vehicle used by the organization in the transport of persons as provided by § 2707.1.
The following provisions shall also apply to organizations issued permits or tags pursuant to §§ 2704.2, 2704.3, 2704.4, 2704.5, 2704.6, 2704.8, 2705, 2706, and 2718.

A vehicle displaying a special license tag or permit issued pursuant to this section may only utilize the special parking privileges provided for in this chapter in connection with the transport of disabled persons who meet one or more of the requirements in § 2701.1.
The Director may modify this section by rulemaking.
